definition: clamor/noise/(bound form) sound used to call cats
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua
variant of 嘩然|哗然[hua2 ran2]
in uproar/commotion/causing a storm of protest/tumultuous
variant of 嘩然|哗然[hua2 ran2]
in uproar/commotion/causing a storm of protest/tumultuous
sensationalism/vulgar claptrap to please the crowds/playing to the gallery/demagogy
(onom.) sound of a crash/with a crash
(onom.) sound of a crash/with a crash
(onom.) rustling sound/sound of rain or of sth falling down/in disorder/completely smashed/badly battered/broken to pieces

sentences.english: I heard him asking, tears streaming down on clang.
sentences.chinese: 我一听他这么问，眼泪哗的一下就流了下来。

sentences.english: Each time you press instruction key, you will hear the indicator sound of swoosh from the phone.
sentences.chinese: 每按一次指令都会听到话机内“哗”的提示声音。

sentences.english: Wow, your English is so cool.
Gee. You've hardly got anything on your tray.
sentences.chinese: 哗，你的盘子里几乎没什么东西。

sentences.english: He won 500 and then blued lot in three days.
sentences.chinese: 他赢了500英镑，郎是撑三添就哗得精光。

sentences.english: How time flew. I did one section after another. The test was over without my knowing it.
sentences.chinese: 哗，又另一部分做完了，于不知不觉之间中考完了试。

sentences.english: “We ain’t servin’ supper double.” Charlie huffed and flipped a page of his newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 查理“哗”地一声翻了一页报纸。

definition: (onom.) sound of a crash/with a crash
with a crash/with a thunderous noise
(onom.) giggling/breathing/tearing of paper, ripping of fabric etc
(onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires
